--- title: "Coral collections & tank acclimation" subtitle: "For spawning of Montipora capitata rice corals" author: "Sarah Tanja" date: 07/09/2024 date-format: long date-modified: today categories: [protocols] toc: true toc-title: Contents toc-depth: 5 toc-location: left reference-location: margin citation-location: margin link-external-icon: true link-external-newwindow: true --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ## load libraries library(tidyverse) library(kableExtra) library(leaflet) ``` ::: # Coral collection location ![Lagoon snorkel entrance to fringing reef surrounding HIMB](Lagoon%20surrounding%20HIMB%2021.431215°N,%20-157.787347°W.png) ![](KB-patchreefs-1.jpg) ![](KB-patchreef-latlon.jpg) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} coral_collection <- data.frame( site = 'HIMB', reef = 1, lat = 21.431215, lon = -157.787347, collection_date = 06/30/2024, colony_count = 20, colony_size_cm = 30, permit = 'SAP2024-35') # Prepare the text for the tooltip: mytext <- paste( "Patch Reef: ", coral_collection$reef, "
", "Date: ", coral_collection$collection_date) %>% lapply(htmltools::HTML) # Generate Map KB <- leaflet(coral_collection) %>% addTiles() %>% setView( lng = -157.787347, lat = 21.431215, zoom = 18 ) %>% addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery") %>% addCircleMarkers(~lon, ~lat, fillColor = "orange", fillOpacity = 0.7, color="white", radius=8, stroke=FALSE, label = mytext, labelOptions = labelOptions( style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px"), textsize = "13px", direction = "auto") ) # Display map KB ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: # Tank acclimation ![HIMB blue tank dimensions](PXL_20220612_035159238~2.jpg) In inches the tank dimensions are 48in W x 55in L x 18in D. The water height was variable, and determined by the level of the stand-pipe. During acclimation 30cm diameter corals were kept in water \~15in deep. Total volume of water that corals were acclimated in was therefore: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} incube <- 48*15*55 print(paste(incube,'inches cubed')) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "39600 inches cubed" ``` ::: ::: 1in^3^ (1 cubic inch) is equal to 0.0043290043 US gallons. The volume of water in gallons is therefore: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gal <- incube*0.0043290043 print(paste(gal, 'gallons')) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "171.42857028 gallons" ``` ::: ::: Finally, 1US gallon = 3.78541 liters ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} L <- gal*3.78541 print(paste(L, 'liters')) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "648.927424223615 liters" ``` ::: ::: We used [12qt(11.4L) cambro chambers](https://www.cambro.com/Products/food-storage/square-food-storage-containers/camsquares-classic-food-storage-containers/camsquares-camwear/12SFSCW135) as the individual bins for spawning.
